intro: Grindelia squarrosa var. nuda, commonly known as the naked sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its gray-green, hairy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its structure is compact, with multiple stems that branch near the base, forming a low-growing shrub. The species is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient plant in harsh desert conditions.
